sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for providing gentle and uniform heating using water as a medium.
sections.scope: Applicable to general laboratory heating in Pharmaceutical Chemistry.
procedure: Fill the bath with distilled water up to the required level.
Switch ON the power and set the desired temperature.
Wait for the water to reach the set temperature and stabilize.
Place the sample containers or racks into the bath.
Keep the lid closed to prevent excessive evaporation and maintain temperature.
Monitor the water level periodically and top up if necessary.
Turn OFF the power and unplug the unit after use.
Drain and clean the bath weekly to prevent scaling and contamination.
precautions: Never turn ON the heater if the bath is empty.
Use distilled water to prevent mineral deposits on the heating elements.
Do not use the water bath for temperatures above 95Â°C.
Ensure the electrical cord and plug are kept dry.
Wait for the water to cool before draining or moving the bath.
